alert.note: Alert for Calvert; Charles; St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 5:15PM EDT until July 25 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... St. Marys County in southern Maryland... Southern Calvert County in southern Maryland... Central Charles County in southern Maryland... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 515 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Popes Creek, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Lexington Park, Chesapeake Ranch Estates, La Plata, Leonardtown, Prince Frederick, Nanjemoy Creek, Popes Creek, Greenwell State Park, Hallowing Point, Saint Leonard Creek, Town Creek, Cuckold Creek, Sheridan Point, Calvert Cliffs, Port Tobacco River, Flag Harbor, California, Golden Beach, Lusby and Patuxent River Naval Air Station. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
